intro: Dicyrta parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered dicyrta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Dicyrta parviflora is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
